Following the 1949 Seminar, a request was approved at the 1949
Convention,which was submitted to the Vv. K. Kellogg Foundation for

headquarters for the NAEB, with a paid permanent staff* It was with the
granting of these requested funds, on May 23, 1851, that what had
previously been only a dream began to become reality*
Within four years of the first grant, the NAEB Radio fretwork was

of educational radio and television facilities throughout the nation.
It is obvious that, before a true profession can be developed,
professional personnel must be created to fill it, and must be numerous
enough to justify it. During the past ten years, to this end, the NAEB
has conducted some 24 Seminars and workshops for the various types of
personnel responsible for the educational broadcast facilities of the
nation. These are outlined in the attached “Training Program of the
